CreateConnector.documentation: Creates a connector using the specified properties.
CreateConnector.name: CreateConnector

CreateCustomPlugin.documentation: Creates a custom plugin using the specified properties.
CreateCustomPlugin.name: CreateCustomPlugin

CreateWorkerConfiguration.documentation: Creates a worker configuration using the specified properties.
CreateWorkerConfiguration.name: CreateWorkerConfiguration

DescribeCustomPlugin.documentation: A summary description of the custom plugin.
DescribeCustomPlugin.name: DescribeCustomPlugin

ListConnectors.documentation: Returns a list of all the connectors in this account and Region. The list is limited to connectors whose name starts with the specified prefix. The response also includes a description of each of the listed connectors.
ListConnectors.name: ListConnectors

ListCustomPlugins.documentation: Returns a list of all of the custom plugins in this account and Region.
ListCustomPlugins.name: ListCustomPlugins

ListWorkerConfigurations.documentation: Returns a list of all of the worker configurations in this account and Region.
ListWorkerConfigurations.name: ListWorkerConfigurations

ApacheKafkaCluster.documentation: The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

vpc.documentation: Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache Kafka cluster.

ApacheKafkaClusterDescription.documentation: The description of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

vpc.documentation: Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache Kafka cluster.

maxWorkerCount.documentation: The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.

mcuCount.documentation: The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.

minWorkerCount.documentation: The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.

AutoScalingDescription.documentation: Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.

maxWorkerCount.documentation: The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.

mcuCount.documentation: The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.

minWorkerCount.documentation: The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.

AutoScalingUpdate.documentation: The updates to the auto scaling parameters for the connector.

maxWorkerCount.documentation: The target maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.

mcuCount.documentation: The target number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.

minWorkerCount.documentation: The target minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.

scaleInPolicy.documentation: The target sacle-in policy for the connector.

scaleOutPolicy.documentation: The target sacle-out policy for the connector.

BadRequestException.documentation: HTTP Status Code 400: Bad request due to incorrect input. Correct your request and then retry it.

Capacity.documentation: Information about the capacity of the connector, whether it is auto scaled or provisioned.

autoScaling.documentation: Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.

provisionedCapacity.documentation: Details about a fixed capacity allocated to a connector.

CapacityUpdate.documentation: The target capacity for the connector. The capacity can be auto scaled or provisioned.

CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery.documentation: The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

enabled.documentation: Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.

logGroup.documentation: The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log delivery.

CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription.documentation: A description of the log delivery settings.

enabled.documentation: Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.

ConflictException.documentation: HTTP Status Code 409: Conflict. A resource with this name already exists. Retry your request with another name.

connectorArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector.

creationTime.documentation: The time that the connector was created.

kafkaCluster.documentation: The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

kafkaClusterClientAuthentication.documentation: The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.

kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit.documentation: Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

kafkaConnectVersion.documentation: The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.

logDelivery.documentation: The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

plugins.documentation: Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.

serviceExecutionRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access Amazon Web Services resources.

workerConfiguration.documentation: The worker configurations that are in use with the connector.

capacity.documentation: Information about the capacity allocated to the connector. Exactly one of the two properties must be specified.

connectorConfiguration.documentation: A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the connector.

kafkaCluster.documentation: Specifies which Apache Kafka cluster to connect to.

kafkaClusterClientAuthentication.documentation: Details of the client authentication used by the Apache Kafka cluster.

kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit.documentation: Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

kafkaConnectVersion.documentation: The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.

plugins.documentation: Specifies which plugins to use for the connector.

serviceExecutionRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access the Amazon Web Services resources that it needs. The types of resources depends on the logic of the connector. For example, a connector that has Amazon S3 as a destination must have permissions that allow it to write to the S3 destination bucket.

workerConfiguration.documentation: Specifies which worker configuration to use with the connector.

connectorArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that Amazon assigned to the connector.

description.documentation: A summary description of the custom plugin.

location.documentation: Information about the location of a custom plugin.

creationTime.documentation: The time that the worker configuration was created.

latestRevision.documentation: The latest revision of the worker configuration.

workerConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that Amazon assigned to the worker configuration.

CustomPlugin.documentation: A plugin is an AWS resource that contains the code that defines a connector's logic.

customPluginArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.

fileMd5.documentation: The hex-encoded MD5 checksum of the custom plugin file. You can use it to validate the file.

fileSize.documentation: The size in bytes of the custom plugin file. You can use it to validate the file.

nextToken.documentation: If the response of a ListConnectors operation is truncated, it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to continue listing from where the previous operation left off.
